Aberration.name: Aberration
Aberration.description: A beholder hovers in a cluttered laboratory. The Aberration card embodies things contrary to nature.

person: Someone with a distorted view of reality, perhaps a cultist or a warlock of the Great Old One; perhaps simply an eccentric person with a nonconformist style.
A person (perhaps a druid) dedicated to preserving nature against corrupting influences.
creatureTrap: A creature corrupted by the influence of the Far Realm, or an Aberration.
A creature that has resisted the corruption of its nature, or a trap that deals psychic damage.
place: A place where the laws of physics or magic are suspended or distorted.
A place where nature has overgrown the remnants of a corrupting influence.
treasure: An art object that reflects a warped view of reality, or a magic item made by Aberrations.
An art object depicting the triumph of nature over corruption, or a magic item useful against Aberrations (such as a Ring of Mind Shielding).
situation: An incursion of energy or creatures from the Far Realm or the deep Underdark.
People or creatures fighting against the influence of Aberrations.

Balance.name: Balance
Balance.description: A set of scales holds day and night in balance. This card deals with many aspects of balance, or with things being out of balance.

person: A fair-minded person who can see multiple perspectives and judge impartially.
A judgmental or biased person willfully ignoring one perspective in favor of another.
creatureTrap: A trap, a Beast, a Construct, or an otherwise impartial foe.
A Celestial, a Fiend, or some other creature strongly associated with a particular alignment or ideology.
place: A place where different forces exist in balance—such as a civilization in balance with nature, a land in balance with water, or chaos in balance with order.
A place where the balance of elemental or natural forces has been upset, with negative consequences.
treasure: A treasure with value to two competing factions, or with two equal magical powers.
A treasure valuable only to certain people, or that can be used only in a very specific way.
situation: A situation where maintaining balance is important: keeping rivals satisfied, preserving the balance of power among different authorities, or rejecting false dichotomies and forced choices.
Something being over- or undervalued.

Beast.name: Beast
Beast.description: The Beast card points to creatures of the animal kingdom and foul, cruel, or bad-tempered behavior in people.

person: A person who avoids the comforts of civilization or indulges predatory attitudes.
A person who fiercely represses urges they deem "bestial" in themselves or others.
creatureTrap: A Beast, or a similar creature (such as a Fey or a Monstrosity) that is animal-like; alternatively, a pit or other confined space with a trapped animal within.
A domesticated animal or a familiar.
place: A place where animals roam freely.
A place where animals are contained, such as a farm or a zoo.
treasure: A treasure that incorporates fur, feathers, bones, or claws from a Beast, or a magic item that allows transformation into a Beast (such as a Cloak of the Bat or Staff of the Python).
An ornate saddle, a goad, or another item related to the use of domestic animals, or a magic item that allows control of Beasts (such as a Potion of Animal Friendship).
situation: A situation involving hunting animals or animals preying on people.
Domestic animals rebelling against people's control.

Book.name: Book
Book.description: An enormous book rests among scrolls and parchment, with a quill and ink nearby. The Book card embodies written information.

person: A writer, poet, or compulsive note-taker.
A well-educated person who reads often.
creatureTrap: A creature that keeps an exhaustive diary in some form, or that seeks a scribe to record its deeds.
A trap involving written runes (such as a Glyph of Warding or Symbol spell).
place: A scriptorium or printing press.
A library or another storehouse of written knowledge.
treasure: A valuable or magical pen, an ink vial, or a set of pigments (such as Nolzur's Marvelous Pigments).
A valuable or magical written work, such as a book or scroll.
situation: A situation that requires gleaning information from written clues.
Secrets that should never have been discovered but were written down.

Bridge.name: Bridge
Bridge.description: A stone bridge arcs across a waterway. A shadowy figure lurks under the bridge, only its gleaming eyes clearly visible. This card reflects the effort required to overcome obstacles.

person: A mediator who enjoys helping others overcome misunderstandings or grievances.
A person who is part of a longstanding feud between two families or groups.
creatureTrap: Someone who coordinates the efforts of different kinds of creatures, such as a mind flayer mastermind using grimlocks and trolls as agents.
A creature that lairs near, on, or under a bridge and either collects tolls from those using the bridge or tries to eat them.
place: A bridge across a river or chasm.
A river or chasm with no bridge, or where the bridge is unsafe or has collapsed.
treasure: An art object depicting a bridge, or a magic item intended to help overcome obstacles (such as Boots of Striding and Springing).
An art object depicting walls, barriers. or a labyrinth; alternatively, a magic item that creates magical walls (such as a Cube of Force).
situation: An urgent need for bridges between long-opposed factions.
Open conflict between two families or groups.

Campfire.name: Campfire
Campfire.description: A large campfire offers safety and comfort in the night. This card suggests a need for rest.

person: A person on vacation, enjoying time away from work and pursuing activities they enjoy.
An exhausted person.
creatureTrap: A creature that alternates brief periods of activity with long periods of rest (as many reptiles and Dragons do); alternatively, a trap that requires a long time to reset between activations.
A creature immune to exhaustion (such as an angel, a golem, an Ooze, or an Undead), or a trap or hazard with a constant, ongoing effect.
place: A place recently used as a campsite.
Somewhere not conducive to rest, such as a busy marketplace active at all hours.
treasure: An art object depicting a peaceful scene, or a magic item that facilitates safe rest (such as a Rod of Security).
An art object that suggests frenetic activity, or a magic item that helps its user remain alert (such as a Sentinel Shield),
situation: A period of rest in the middle of a journey or an adventure.
A situation that demands unrelenting activity.

Cavern.name: Cavern
Cavern.description: A vast cavern is adorned with glowing fungi and striking stone formations. The Cavern card suggests exploration and delving into hidden secrets.

person: A person who asks probing questions but shares little.
A person who lives for the moment, avoiding introspection.
creatureTrap: A creature (such as a piercer or a roper) that mimics the features of natural caverns.
A creature that swallows prey whole, or a trap that causes a ceiling or roof to collapse.
place: A cavern or a cavernous building such as a large temple.
A small niche or cave.
treasure: A geode, jewelry made from gems and precious metals, or a magic item that grants darkvision (such as Goggles of Night).
An art object that lacks a sense of depth or perspective.
situation: A situation that requires delving into hidden motivations and secrets.
Everyone's motivations exposed for all to see.

Celestial.name: Celestial
Celestial.description: A beautiful couatl twines through the clouds. This card suggests the involvement of celestial beings and service to the divine.

person: A devout person who looks for miracles and the presence of the divine in all parts of life.
Someone who carries a grudge over a real or perceived injury caused by a god or Celestial.
creatureTrap: A Celestial or other creature that has connections to the gods, or a trap that deals radiant damage.
A fallen Celestial or similar creature that has lost its connection to the divine,
place: A location on the upper planes, or a place suffused with their influence.
A place intended to ward off Celestials and influence from the Upper Planes.
treasure: An art object depicting angels or other Celestials, treasure from the Upper Planes, or magic items made by Celestials.
A treasure depicting a Celestial's fall, or a magic item useful against Celestials.
situation: Communication between the Upper Planes and the Material Plane—perhaps in dreams or visions, or with Celestials as intermediaries.
A situation involving Celestials' unwelcome interference in mortal affairs.

Comet.name: Comet
Comet.description: A comet with an enormous tail streaks across the winter sky at night, outshining the stars. The Comet card brings dire warnings or devastation.

person: A serious person with a gloomy outlook, perhaps carrying bad news.
A person who is grieving or delights in the suffering of others.
creatureTrap: A creature regarded as an ill omen, or signs that a dire creature approaches; alternatively, a trap marked by clear signs, perhaps surrounded by the corpses of its victims.
The destruction left in the wake ofa rampaging creature, or smaller creatures fleeing from a larger one.
place: A place with a connection to astronomical events: perhaps an observatory or a meteorite's crater.
A ruin where a terrible event occurred in the past and that might now be haunted.
treasure: A treasure that carries a curse, or one whose power is destined to be used for destructive ends.
. A treasure formed or shaped by disaster, bloodstained or haunted by former owners: alternatively, something good arising from a bad situation.
situation: A crisis about to spiral out of control.
The calm after a devastating storm: a situation where people are reeling from awful news or events.

Construct.name: Construct
Construct.description: A modron wields a wrench in the interior of a clockwork machine. This card signifies things made by hand, including Constructs.

person: An artisan who delights in handcrafted goods.
A person who scorns the idea of working with their hands.
creatureTrap: A construct, particularly designed to be animated (like a golem) as opposed to an ordinary object (like a broom or rug) that has been animated.
A creature able to destroy buildings and objects, such as one with the Siege Monster trait.
place: A workshop or art studio.
A garbage heap or another place where objects are discarded.
treasure: An exquisitely crafted art object (especially one with practical use) or magical tools.
An object fashioned with minimum ation of its raw materials, or a magic item useful against Constructs (such as a Mace of Smiting).
situation: An artisan attempting to bring a construct to life.
A rueful artisan attempting to destroy a Construct that has broken free of all restraint.

Corpse.name: Corpse
Corpse.description: An adventurer lies dead in a dungeon hallway, pierced by arrows. The Corpse card embodies decay and corruption.

person: An evil person whose morality has rotted away.
A good person who remains uncorrupted despite being surrounded by wickedness.
creatureTrap: A zombie or similar corporeal Undead whose flesh is decaying, or a trapped corpse.
An Ooze or fungus creature that facilitates the decomposition of corpses.
place: Somewhere things are left to rot, such as a graveyard or charnel house.
A place where fungus grows abundantly on a diet of rotting flesh.
treasure: An art object depicting dead bodies, a corpse just starting to decay, or a magic item that causes decay (such as a Staff of Withering).
A treasure that remains uncorrupted in the midst of rot.
situation: An organization or institution overwhelmed by corruption.
An attempt to corrupt a respected and noble organization.

Crossroads.name: Crossroads
Crossroads.description: A signpost points in many directions at a crossroads. The Crossroads cards warns of a difficult but necessary decision.

person: A person agonizing about a difficult decision or who regrets a recent decision.
A person who refuses to make decisions, relying instead on inaction or random determination.
creatureTrap: A creature that induces confusion or erratic behavior (such as an umber hulk).
A creature that prevents others from acting (such as a ghoul).
place: A crossroads, or a settlement where trade routes cross.
A place that constrains movement, such as a narrow ravine or passage.
treasure: An art object that depicts a crossroads or cross patterns, or a magic item with multiple properties or uses (such as a staff).
An art object featuring overlapping circular patterns, or a magic item that does only does one thing a limited number of times (such as a wand).
situation: A choice between options that are equally appealing—or equally disastrous.
A situation stemming from someone's refusal to act or choose.

Donjon.name: Donjon
Donjon.description: Underground stairs lead to a heavy door made of iron bars. This card represents both imprisonment and freedom.

person: A prisoner, or a person who feels trapped.
A recently freed or escaped prisoner, or a free thinker who rejects social norms.
creatureTrap: A creature that grapples or swallows prey whole.
A creature that has escaped from captivity or gone feral.
place: A place of imprisonment, such as a literal dungeon or a menagerie.
A prison broken open, or a place associated with liberation (such as a monument commemorating emancipation).
treasure: A treasure locked in a vault, or magic with the power to bind or imprison.
A treasure that once held a being captive, such as an Efreeti Bottle that has lost its magic or an empty Iron Flask.
situation: An impasse, a situation that threatens someone's freedom, or a situation where someone's indecision is keeping everyone in suspense.
A situation that requires creative solutions, or an effort to free people or creatures from captivity.

Door.name: Door
Door.description: A large wooden door bars the path ahead. The card offers an opportunity to change.

person: Someone trying to make amends for past misdeeds and adopt a better way of life.
A person who keeps repeating the same mistakes and misdeeds.
creatureTrap: A creature that changes form, or a trapped door.
A creature that causes its prey or enemies to change, such as a lycanthrope or slaad.
place: A door, an open doorway, or a passage from one place to another.
A locked door or barricaded passage.
treasure: An art object that looks very different from various perspectives, or a magic item that creates portals or allows teleportation (such as an Amulet of the Planes).
A jeweled chest or lockbox, or a magic item that resists change (such as an Immovable Rod).
situation: An opportunity to deal with a situation differently than you have in the past.
A situation that keeps recurring.

Dragon.name: Dragon
Dragon.description: A menacing red dragon perches atop its treasure hoard inside a cave. This card can point to things connected to Dragons, but it also suggests hoarding, reed, and places rich in magical energy.

person: A dragonborn, a person who uses draconic magic, a person who is fascinated by dragons, or a person who hoards wealth or other goods.
Someone with a grudge against a particular Dragon or against Dragons in general.
creatureTrap: A Dragon or similar creature.
A dracolich or another Undead dragon, a Construct that resembles a Dragon, or another Dragon-like creature.
place: The lair of a Dragon or some other impressive creature, or a site of great magical power.
A place where a Dragon was slain, leaving a magical or physical scar on the land.
treasure: Large quantities of treasure, though not necessarily of great monetary value (for example, many copper coins or a large collection of cheap statuettes).
An art object depicting the death of a Dragon, or a magic item useful against Dragons (such as a Dragon Slayer).
situation: Someone hoarding resources that are widely needed or desired.
A group that plans to drive a Dragon from its lair, steal from its hoard, or kill it.

Elemental.name: Elemental
Elemental.description: A hungry Xorn feeds in an Underdark cavern. This card suggests an Elemental creature or reducing a thing to its essence.

person: A person who uses magic tied to the elements or who is cartoonishly two-dimensional.
A person driven by an internal conflict between two opposed tendencies or influences.
creatureTrap: An Elemental creature, or a creature that uses air, earth, fire, or water magic.
A creature (such as a mephit) that combines the substance of two Elemental Planes, or creatures from opposing Elemental Planes.
place: A place influenced by the Elemental Planes or associated with an element (such as a cave, a mountain, a volcano, or a river).
A place where forces of the Elemental Planes are in opposition to each other.
treasure: An art object that incorporates material from an Elemental Plane or imagery of the elements, or a magic item that conjures or controls Elementals (such as a Ring of Elemental Command).
An art object that incorporates material from multiple Elemental Planes or imagery of elements in opposition; a magic item useful against Elementals.
situation: Forces from the Elemental Planes spilling into the world.
Opposed forces from two or more Elemental Planes entering the world.

Euryale.name: Euryale
Euryale.description: A female medusa with a serpentine tail instead of legs is surrounded by flowers and herbs. The Euryale card points to vision, insight, and observation,

person: A person who observes without becoming involved or attached,
A nosy person vho inserts themself into situations where they don't belong.
creatureTrap: A medusa or another creature with the power to petrify or a gaze attack.
A creature made of or associated with stone.
place: Somewhere with commanding views, such as a watchtower or a high promontory.
A place with narrow windows (perhaps arrow slits) or with a limited view, perhaps underground.
treasure: A landscape painting or tapestry, or a magic item that enhances vision (such as Goggles of Night).
A valuable sculpture or statue, a gemstone, or a magic item made from stone, such as a Figurine of Wondrous Power.
situation: A situation that rewards or requires careful observation, such as a surveillance operation.
A situation arising from people's unwillingness to observe things as they are, or their tendency to project their own feelings and opinions onto others.

Expert.name: Expert
Expert.description: A bard plays a musical instrument. This card implies expertise, rightly or wrongly applied.

person: A person (perhaps a bard, a rogue, a ranger, or an artificer) with exactly the right skills for the task at hand.
A person who believes themself an expert but isn't actually helpful.
creatureTrap: A creature with abilities similar to those of a bard, ranger, or rogue, such as expertise in one or more skills.
A creature that relies on brute strength instead of skill or stealth.
place: A place (such as a guild hall) where skilled folk gather to share their expertise.
A place where children learn the basics of useful skills.
treasure: A treasure with practical use, such as a musical instrument or a tool.
A wildly impractical treasure with no actual use, unwieldy to wear or display.
situation: A situation that requires and rewards the expert application of practical skills.
A situation stemming from someone's expertise being overlooked or ignored.

Fates.name: Fates
Fates.description: Three sisters weave, measure, and cut the threads of fate. This card explores the repercussions of decisions and reflects on the past.

person: A person perhaps nearing the end of their life, troubled by past mistakes or reflecting on prior decisions.
A person driven by the desire to escape whatever fate has in store.
creatureTrap: A supernatural creature connected to fate, such as a Celestial, modron, or hag.
A creature strongly associated with chaos, such as a demon or a slaad.
place: Somewhere meant for literal or metaphorical reflection, such as a room full of mirrors, a still mountain lake, a monastery, a hermitage, or a library.
A place that discourages reflection, such as a dark place or a noisy, busy one.
treasure: An ornate or magical mirror, tapestry, or other woven treasure; alternatively, magic that can alter fate.
An art object depicting the effort to escape fate, or a magic item powered by chaos.
situation: A situation ordained by fate, perhaps involving a supernatural punishment or reward.
An unjust situation where evil is rewarded and good is punished.

Fey.name: Fey
Fey.description: A blink dog runs through the wild. When upright; this card can refer to a Fey creature or a sense of whimsy; reversed, it points to the gloomy Shadowfell.

person: A person with Fey ancestry or some other connection to the Fey (such as a warlock of the Archfey), or a person with a whimsical sense of humor.
A gloomy person with no sense of humor, or a person who uses shadow-based magic.
creatureTrap: A Fey creature, or some other creature with connections to the Feywild.
A creature from the Shadowfell, or one transformed by shadow energy (such as a shadow dragon).
place: A place in the Feywild, somewhere that allows passage to the Feywild, or a location where Fey magic is active.
A place in the Shadowfell, somewhere that allows passage to the Shadowfell, or a location where shadow magic is active.
treasure: An art object depicting Fey or the Feywild, or a magic item made by Fey.
An art object depicting the Shadowfell, or a magic item that uses shadow magic.
situation: An absurd situation that shouldn't be taken too seriously.
A gloomy situation that offers little hope of success or escape.

Fiend.name: Fiend
Fiend.description: A balor strikes from the depths of the Abyss. This card alludes to an actual Fiend or the forces of the Lower Planes.

person: A tiefling, warlock of the Fiend, member of a Fiend-worshiping cult, or person who seeks to manipulate others into harmful contracts.
A person who carries a grudge over a real or perceived injury caused by a Fiend, or a person trapped in a bargain with a Fiend.
creatureTrap: A Fiend of any sort.
A redeemed Fiend or similar creature that has lost its connection to the Lower Planes.
place: A place on the Lower Planes, or a location suffused with their influence.
A place intended to ward off Fiends and influence from the Lower Planes.
treasure: An art object depicting Fiends, treasure from the Lower Planes, or magic items made by Fiends.
A treasure depicting a Fiend's redemption, or a magic item useful against Fiends.
situation: Interaction between the Lower Planes and the Material Plane perhaps an infernal bargain or demonic destruction.
A situation involving Fiends' unwelcome interference in mortal affairs.

Flames.name: Flames
Flames.description: A chain devil, wreathed in flames, looks menacing and angry. The Flames card brings enemies and vengeance.

person: A person carrying a bitter, possibly violent, grudge that poisons their outlook.
A person who is being hunted or persecuted unjustly.
creatureTrap: A Fiend, a vengeful Undead (such as a ghost or revenant), or a creature dedicated to pursuing designated prey (such as an invisible stalker).
A creature fleeing from a larger or more dangerous foe.
place: A place of bloodshed, or a place with a connection to the Lower Planes.
A place of sanctuary for refugees and fugitives.
treasure: A treasure that has been the subject of intense discord or rivalry, or a magic item originating on the Lower Planes.
A treasure symbolizing or commemorating the end of a feud or war, or a magic item that can charm or calm creatures (such as a Rod of Rulership).
situation: A deep-seated enmity that clouds the judgment of those involved, or someone's thirst for revenge.
Unjust persecution or prejudicial hatred.

Fool.name: Fool
Fool.description: A jester or fool figure, representing new beginnings, innocence, and taking leaps of faith.

person: A naive or innocent individual starting a new journey
Someone making reckless or foolish decisions
creatureTrap: A harmless creature that appears threatening but is actually benign
A dangerous trap disguised as something innocent
place: A new territory or unexplored area full of possibilities
A dangerous cliff or precipice where one might fall
treasure: A simple item with unexpected magical properties
A cursed item that brings misfortune to the unwary
situation: The beginning of a new adventure or quest
A situation where hasty action leads to trouble

Gem.name: Gem
Gem.description: A large, faceted gemstone set in intricate filigree gleams invitingly. The Gem card brings vast wealth.

person: Someone who inherited wealth or whose wealth is the result of good fortune.
A person who has lost wealth or power through a stroke of bad luck.
creatureTrap: A creature connected with wealth, such as a Dragon or a Xorn, or a treasure that doubles as a trap.
A trap or creature that uses the appearance of treasure as bait, such as a mimic.
place: A mine or a treasure vault.
A place associated with poverty, such as a tenement or slum.
treasure: A valuable treasure or a magical gem.
An item that appears valuable but isn't, or a magic item with a curse.
situation: A situation driven by greed, such as siblings vying for an inheritance or someone hunting for a lost treasure.
A situation stemming from the loss of wealth, such as a person trying to recover money given to a con artist or stolen by a thief.

Giant.name: Giant
Giant.description: A massive humanoid figure, representing overwhelming power, strength, and forces beyond normal scale.

person: A powerful leader or authority figure with great influence
Someone who abuses their power or acts as a bully
creatureTrap: A massive creature of incredible strength and endurance
A seemingly powerful foe that is actually weak in some way
place: A vast stronghold or mountain fortress
Unstable terrain that could collapse under great weight
treasure: Massive wealth or artifacts of great size and power
Treasure that is too large or heavy to be practical
situation: A challenge that requires great strength or resources to overcome
Being overwhelmed by forces too large to handle

Humanoid.name: Humanoid
Humanoid.description: A figure representing civilized peoples, communities, and the bonds of society.

person: A helpful ally, friend, or member of the community
A deceitful person who hides malicious intent behind a friendly facade
creatureTrap: Intelligent creatures that can be reasoned with or befriended
Shapeshifters or imposters pretending to be allies
place: A welcoming settlement, town, or civilized area
A place where social tensions or conflicts divide the community
treasure: Items of cultural or sentimental value to a community
Stolen goods or items obtained through betrayal
situation: Opportunities for cooperation, diplomacy, or building relationships
Situations involving deception, betrayal, or social conflict

Jester.name: Jester
Jester.description: A colorful entertainer or trickster, representing humor, chaos, and unexpected wisdom through folly.

person: A wise individual who teaches through humor and unconventional methods
A chaotic troublemaker who causes confusion and mischief
creatureTrap: A playful creature that tests adventurers with riddles or tricks
A malicious entity that uses humor to mask dangerous intent
place: A place of entertainment, festivals, or celebration
A location where appearances are deceiving and nothing is as it seems
treasure: Items that appear worthless but have hidden value or power
Cursed items that bring both benefit and misfortune
situation: Moments where humor or creativity solve serious problems
Chaotic situations where plans go awry in unexpected ways

Key.name: Key
Key.description: This large metal key is bizarrely complicated. The Key card represents the perfect solution to a problem or having the right tool for the job.

person: A person with the skills or tools needed to solve the current problem.
A person ill equipped for the challenges they face.
creatureTrap: A creature that preys on the party's weaknesses, or a trap that can be disarmed only with a key.
A creature with vulnerabilities, or a trap that's bizarrely complex.
place: A place through which only certain people are allowed to pass, or where a key is required.
An open and easily accessed place.
treasure: A magic item needed to overcome an obstacle or defeat an enemy, or the means to unlock a treasure (such as a Chime of Opening).
A treasure in a locked container, or magic that slows creatures.
situation: A situation that be resolved successfully only by taking a specific action.
A situation stemming from someone's refusal to act or choose.

Knight.name: Knight
Knight.description: A knight formed of folded cards offers a sword also made from cards. The Knight card signifies trust and loyalty.

person: A trustworthy person who _honors their commitments.
A person who can't be trusted, or a traitor posing as a loyal friend.
creatureTrap: A creature bound by oaths or who serves someone else.
A knight who has failed to live up to their code of honor (such as a death knight).
place: A place of sanctuary, where strong traditions protect those who take shelter inside.
A place where a great betrayal took place, or a location with treacherous terrain or traps.
treasure: A treasure celebrating or commemorating an oath (such as a wedding ring), or magic weapons or armor associated with knights or paladins.
A treasure that carries a hidden curse, or a magic item that fails when it's needed most.
situation: A situation that requires loyalty in one's companions and faithfulness to them.
A situation involving the betrayal of trust, or rampant suspicion.

Lance.name: Lance
Lance.description: A long spear or lance, representing focused attack, precision, and the ability to strike from a distance.

person: A skilled warrior with focus and precision in combat
Someone who strikes without warning or consideration for others
creatureTrap: Creatures with natural weapons like spikes, horns, or stingers
Hidden spikes or piercing traps that activate unexpectedly
place: A battlefield or arena where combat skills are tested
A dangerous passage with numerous piercing hazards
treasure: Masterwork weapons or armor with exceptional reach or precision
Weapons that are difficult to wield or come with significant drawbacks
situation: Opportunities to strike decisively at the right moment
Situations where aggressive action leads to unintended consequences

Mage.name: Mage
Mage.description: A robed spellcaster, representing arcane knowledge, magical power, and the pursuit of understanding.

person: A wise scholar or mentor with valuable magical knowledge
An arrogant or power-hungry individual who abuses magical abilities
creatureTrap: Magical creatures or constructs with spellcasting abilities
Magical traps that require specific knowledge or counterspells to bypass
place: A library, tower, or academy where magical knowledge is preserved
A place corrupted or warped by uncontrolled magical energies
treasure: Spell scrolls, magical tomes, or arcane components
Cursed magical items that corrupt or drain the user
situation: Problems that require magical solutions or arcane knowledge
Situations where magical interference complicates simple matters

Map.name: Map
Map.description: A detailed chart or map, representing guidance, navigation, and the knowledge needed to find one's way.

person: A guide or navigator who knows the way forward
Someone who provides misleading directions or false information
creatureTrap: Creatures that can track or navigate expertly through terrain
Illusory or shape-shifting creatures that lead travelers astray
place: A location that serves as a crossroads or navigation point
A confusing maze or area where normal navigation fails
treasure: Charts, maps, or navigational tools of great value
False maps or misleading documents that lead to danger
situation: Clear direction and guidance toward achieving goals
Confusion about which path to take or being lost

Maze.name: Maze
Maze.description: A complex labyrinth with winding passages, representing confusion, complexity, and the challenge of finding the right path.

person: Someone with deep knowledge who can navigate complex situations
A person who creates confusion or deliberately complicates matters
creatureTrap: Creatures that excel at creating or navigating complex environments
Traps that involve multiple steps or misdirection to overcome
place: A complex dungeon or structure with multiple paths and secrets
A place where one easily becomes lost or trapped
treasure: Rewards hidden in the most difficult to reach locations
Treasures that are surrounded by complex puzzles or obstacles
situation: Complex problems that require careful navigation and patience
Overwhelming confusion where every choice seems to lead to more problems

Mine.name: Mine
Mine.description: A deep excavation site, representing hidden wealth, dangerous depths, and the rewards of hard work.

person: A hardworking individual who uncovers hidden value through persistence
Someone who exploits others' labor or takes credit for others' work
creatureTrap: Creatures that burrow or live in underground environments
Cave-ins, gas pockets, or structural collapses in underground areas
place: Rich underground deposits of valuable materials or information
Dangerous underground areas prone to collapse or toxic conditions
treasure: Raw materials, gems, or precious metals of great value
Resources that require dangerous or expensive extraction methods
situation: Opportunities that require hard work but promise great rewards
Situations where pursuing gain leads to dangerous or unstable conditions

Monstrosity.name: Monstrosity
Monstrosity.description: An aberrant creature of unnatural origin, representing chaos, mutation, and things that defy natural order.

person: An individual with unique abilities who stands apart from normal society
Someone whose actions or nature have become corrupted and inhuman
creatureTrap: Bizarre creatures with unusual abilities that defy expectations
Unnatural hazards or phenomena that operate by unknown rules
place: Locations touched by chaos or unnatural forces
Areas where reality is unstable or dangerous mutations occur
treasure: Unique items with strange properties that normal magic cannot explain
Cursed or tainted items that corrupt those who use them
situation: Unique challenges that require unconventional solutions
Situations that spiral into chaos beyond anyone's control

Moon.name: Moon
Moon.description: A crescent moon looms large in the autumn sky. The Moon card points to hidden potential.

person: Someone whose fine qualities are masked by one annoying trait.
A person who seems competent but bungles everything they attempt.
creatureTrap: A lycanthrope, or a creature that appears to be an inanimate object until it strikes (such as a gargoyle).
A creature that uses its fearsome appearance to frighten away others because it is too weak to fight.
place: A secret chamber or a place concealed by terrain; alternatively, a place larger or more elaborate on the inside than it seems from outside.
A place with an impressive exterior but a dingy, poorly maintained interior.
treasure: A treasure whose value isn't immediately apparent, or a magic item that appears to be a worthless object.
A treasure that seems more valuable than it is, perhaps an ordinary item that falsely appears magical.
situation: A problem that requires investigation and is more complicated than it appears.
A situation that seems—and is—too good to be true.

Ooze.name: Ooze
Ooze.description: A gelatinous, amorphous creature, representing adaptability, persistence, and slow but inevitable progress.

person: Someone who adapts to any situation and persists despite obstacles
A person who slowly corrupts or consumes everything around them
creatureTrap: Creatures that are difficult to harm with conventional weapons
Slow-acting hazards that gradually become more dangerous over time
place: Locations that slowly change or adapt to circumstances
Areas that are slowly being consumed or corrupted by some force
treasure: Items that improve or adapt based on how they are used
Treasures that slowly degrade or corrupt over time
situation: Gradual progress that eventually leads to significant change
Slow-building problems that become serious if not addressed

Path.name: Path
Path.description: A winding trail or road, representing journey, choices, and the direction one takes in life.

person: A guide or mentor who helps others find their way
Someone who leads others down the wrong path or into danger
creatureTrap: Creatures that patrol or guard specific routes or territories
Hazards that block progress or force difficult detours
place: A route that leads to important destinations or discoveries
A path that leads to danger, dead ends, or becomes impassable
treasure: Items found along the way that aid in travel or exploration
Obstacles or tolls that must be paid to continue forward
situation: Clear direction and progress toward goals
Being forced to take difficult detours or face unexpected obstacles

Pit.name: Pit
Pit.description: A deep hole or chasm, representing hidden dangers, sudden setbacks, and the risk of falling.

person: Someone who helps others avoid hidden dangers or pitfalls
A person who creates traps or leads others into dangerous situations
creatureTrap: Creatures that attack from below or use burrowing tactics
Hidden pits, spike traps, or other concealed ground hazards
place: Deep caverns or chasms that lead to hidden areas
Unstable ground where one might fall into hidden dangers
treasure: Valuable items hidden in deep or hard-to-reach places
Treasures that are trapped or guarded by hidden dangers
situation: Opportunities to avoid or overcome hidden obstacles
Sudden setbacks or falling into unexpected difficulties

Plant.name: Plant
Plant.description: A growing plant or tree, representing natural growth, patience, and the cycles of life.

person: Someone who nurtures growth and has patience for natural development
A person who becomes stagnant or overgrown with bad habits
creatureTrap: Plant creatures or beings connected to natural growth
Entangling vines, poisonous plants, or overgrown hazardous terrain
place: Fertile areas rich in natural resources and healing plants
Overgrown areas where nature has become wild and dangerous
treasure: Natural remedies, herbs, or items that grow in value over time
Resources that are seasonal or require specific conditions to obtain
situation: Gradual growth and development leading to positive outcomes
Stagnation or being overwhelmed by unchecked growth

Priest.name: Priest
Priest.description: A religious figure in ceremonial robes, representing divine power, healing, and spiritual guidance.

person: A healer or spiritual guide who provides wisdom and comfort
A fanatic or false prophet who uses religion to manipulate others
creatureTrap: Divine creatures or beings blessed with healing powers
Cursed or corrupted religious sites with dangerous spiritual energy
place: Sacred temples or shrines that offer sanctuary and healing
Desecrated holy sites where divine power has been corrupted
treasure: Holy relics, blessed items, or divine magic that aids the faithful
Cursed religious artifacts that punish the unworthy
situation: Opportunities for healing, redemption, or spiritual growth
Religious conflicts or divine judgment that brings hardship

Prisoner.name: Prisoner
Prisoner.description: A figure bound in chains or behind bars, representing confinement, limitation, and the need for freedom.

person: Someone who has been wrongly confined and deserves rescue
A dangerous individual who should remain imprisoned for everyone's safety
creatureTrap: Creatures that have been bound or imprisoned by ancient magic
Restraining devices or magical bindings that prevent escape
place: Prisons, dungeons, or secure facilities holding valuable captives
Places of confinement that have become corrupted or dangerous
treasure: Items that grant freedom or help overcome constraints
Cursed items that bind or constrain the user
situation: Opportunities to gain freedom or help others escape oppression
Being trapped by circumstances or bound by unbreakable obligations

Puzzle.name: Puzzle
Puzzle.description: An intricate mechanical device or riddle, representing challenges that require intellect and patience to solve.

person: A clever individual who enjoys solving complex problems
Someone who makes things unnecessarily complicated or confusing
creatureTrap: Intelligent creatures that challenge adventurers with riddles or tests
Complex mechanical traps that require multiple steps to disarm
place: Locations with hidden mechanisms or secret knowledge to discover
Areas where simple actions have unexpected and complex consequences
treasure: Items that require skill or knowledge to unlock their true potential
Complex devices that are difficult to use or understand
situation: Problems that can be solved through careful thought and analysis
Overly complex situations where simple solutions are overlooked

Ring.name: Ring
Ring.description: A circular band of metal, representing bonds, commitments, and things that come full circle.

person: Someone who honors commitments and maintains strong relationships
A person trapped in cycles of behavior or bound by unwanted obligations
creatureTrap: Creatures that form protective circles or work in connected groups
Magical barriers or binding circles that prevent movement or escape
place: Circular or enclosed areas that offer protection and unity
Places where one becomes trapped in endless cycles or routines
treasure: Items that strengthen bonds between allies or enhance cooperation
Cursed items that create unwanted bonds or dependencies
situation: Completion of cycles, fulfillment of promises, or strengthened alliances
Being trapped in repetitive patterns or bound by restrictive agreements

Rogue.name: Rogue
Rogue.description: A roguish kenku lurking in the shadows holds a dagger, poised to strike. This card suggests treachery and deception.

person: A deceptive person hiding a sinister secret; pursuit of their own aims trumps any friendship or loyalty.
A good-hearted person entangled in a criminal or evil organization who is desperate for a way out.
creatureTrap: A dangerous creature that strikes by surprise or from darkness.
A creature unwillingly bound to the service of villains.
place: A front for a criminal operation, or a monster's lair.
An oasis of compassion surrounded by violence.
treasure: A treasure that hides a deadly secret, such as a ring with a spring-loaded poison needle, a Dagger of Venom, or a cursed magic item.
A treasure caked in grime or hidden in a filthy place.
situation: A situation rooted in or destined for betrayal.
Good characters who are part of an evil organization or who plot to subvert it.

Ruin.name: Ruin
Ruin.description: An elegant sword and crown disintegrate into eddies of ash. The Ruin card warns of the inevitability of decay and the danger of material attachments.

person: A person who has renounced material attachments, such as a religious ascetic.
A person excessively attached to material goods (not necessarily excessive wealth).
creatureTrap: A creature that destroys equipment, such as a rust monster or a black pudding.
A Construct, especially an animated object.
place: A ruin, or a retreat for ascetics.
A place meant to store goods, such as a warehouse or an armory.
treasure: A treasure that is broken or in disrepair.
Valuable trade goods, well-made equipment, or a deed to property.
situation: A situation involving the decay of objects or relationships over a long period of time.
A situation involving the production or transportation of goods for sale.

Sage.name: Sage
Sage.description: The mind of a sage is filled with obscure lore gained through exhaustive research. This card represents well-intentioned advice.

person: A person who offers helpful advice in difficult circumstances.
Someone who helpfully offers bad advice.
creatureTrap: A helpful creature that leads the way to safety or a goal.
A creature that tries to lead the way into danger or a trap.
place: A place dedicated to knowledge and wisdom, such as a library or university.
A place whose structural flaws threaten its integrity.
treasure: A valuable or magical book or scroll, or a sentient magic item that is known to provide helpful advice.
A device valuable for its components that doesn't function as intended, or a sentient magic item that provides bad but well-intentioned advice.
situation: An opportunity to provide valuable advice on a familiar subject.
An opportunity to provide advice on a completely unfamiliar subject.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A protective barrier held in defense, representing protection, security, and the ability to guard against harm.

person: A protector or guardian who defends others from harm
Someone who hides behind defenses and avoids taking necessary risks
creatureTrap: Creatures with natural armor or defensive abilities
Barriers or defensive mechanisms that protect valuable areas
place: Fortified locations that offer safety and protection
Overly defensive places that become isolated or stagnant
treasure: Protective items, armor, or wards that defend against specific threats
Defensive items that hinder mobility or prevent necessary action
situation: Successfully defending against threats or protecting what matters
Being overly cautious and missing opportunities due to excessive caution

Ship.name: Ship
Ship.description: A sailing vessel on the water, representing journeys, exploration, and crossing into unknown territories.

person: An experienced traveler or explorer who opens new possibilities
Someone who abandons responsibilities or flees from commitments
creatureTrap: Aquatic creatures or beings that control waterways
Hazards related to water travel like storms, reefs, or whirlpools
place: Harbors, ports, or coastal areas that connect to distant lands
Dangerous waters or areas cut off from safe passage
treasure: Exotic goods from distant lands or navigational instruments
Cargo that is difficult to transport or contraband that brings trouble
situation: New opportunities for exploration and discovering distant possibilities
Being cut off from familiar support or facing uncertain journeys

Skull.name: Skull
Skull.description: A skeletal figure is shrouded in a swirling robe, though its skull is clearly visible. The Skull card is a reminder of the universality of death—and the fact that everyone must confront death alone.

person: A person facing imminent death, or one who wields necromantic power.
Someone haunted by the inevitability of death and seeking to escape it, or a person who has returned from death.
creatureTrap: An Undead creature, or a trap that deals necrotic damage.
An immortal creature or one that doesn't age, such as an angel, a Fiend, or a naga.
place: A place of solitude and isolation, or a place where someone died recently.
A graveyard or another place where the dead are gathered.
treasure: A treasure associated with death (perhaps funerary implements), or a magic item with necromantic power.
An art object that celebrates or depicts deliverance from death, or a magic item that wards off death (such as a Periapt of Wound Closure or a Scarab of Protection).
situation: A person's life in peril.
Many lives at stake.

Staff.name: Staff
Staff.description: A long wooden rod or magical staff, representing authority, magical power, and the ability to direct energy.

person: A leader or authority figure who guides others with wisdom and power
Someone who abuses their position of authority or magical abilities
creatureTrap: Creatures that wield magical or supernatural powers
Magical wards or energy-based traps that require specific countermeasures
place: Seats of power, magical academies, or places where authority is exercised
Areas where power has been corrupted or magical energies are unstable
treasure: Magical implements, symbols of authority, or items that focus power
Items that grant power but corrupt the user or demand a price
situation: Opportunities to exercise leadership or channel power effectively
Situations where power is misused or authority is challenged

Stairway.name: Stairway
Stairway.description: A set of steps leading upward or downward, representing progress, elevation, and transitions between levels.

person: Someone who helps others advance or reach higher levels of achievement
A person who looks down on others or creates barriers to advancement
creatureTrap: Creatures that control vertical spaces or have climbing abilities
Traps triggered by movement between different levels or elevations
place: Multi-level structures that lead to important upper or lower areas
Dangerous vertical passages where falling poses significant risk
treasure: Rewards that become available only after achieving certain levels
Items that are difficult to transport between different elevations
situation: Clear progression toward higher goals or deeper understanding
Setbacks that force retreat to lower levels or starting over

Star.name: Star
Star.description: A brilliant star shines in the spring sky at twilight. The Star card represents inherent ability and training working in concert—nature allied with nurture.

person: A person focused on improving a particular area of skill or behavior.
A person with natural ability but little patience for training or study.
creatureTrap: A creature that has trained to improve itself (perhaps having several skill or saving throw proficiencies), or a trap that requires teamwork to avoid or escape.
A creature that relies on its natural abilities instead of training (perhaps with no skill or saving throw proficiencies).
place: A place dedicated to study or training, such as a university or gymnasium.
A place of untouched natural beauty.
treasure: An art object that reflects the skill of its creator, or a magic item that grants proficiency.
Unrefined ore or uncut gems, or a magic item that improves an ability score.
situation: A situation that requires or rewards training and practice.
A situation resulting from someone's refusal to practice or train.

Statue.name: Statue
Statue.description: A carved stone figure frozen in time, representing permanence, memory, and things that endure through ages.

person: Someone who preserves important traditions or serves as a lasting example
A person who has become rigid, unchanging, or stuck in the past
creatureTrap: Creatures made of stone or those that can petrify others
Ancient guardians or constructs that activate when disturbed
place: Memorial sites, ancient ruins, or places that preserve important history
Locations frozen in time where nothing changes or grows
treasure: Ancient artifacts, historical records, or items of lasting value
Cursed items that turn things to stone or prevent change
situation: Establishing something permanent or honoring lasting achievements
Being stuck in unchanging patterns or refusing to adapt

Sun.name: Sun
Sun.description: A sun blazes brightly in the summer sky. The Sun card brings hope—either well-founded or deluded.

person: A person with an unflappable and optimistic outlook, confident in the power of good triumphing over evil and obstacles.
A naively positive person who spouts empty platitudes about everything turning out for the best.
creatureTrap: An angel or a similar creature that embodies hope and good.
A creature (perhaps a flumph or a pixie) that offers aid but is too weak to provide meaningful help.
place: A place that embodies hope in the face of despair, such as a temple next to a graveyard or a town rebuilding after a natural disaster.
A desecrated temple or similar place where dirt or corruption has eliminated all evidence of goodness and holiness.
treasure: A valuable religious object devoted to good, or a holy or protective magic item.
A religious object or holy magic item that has been desecrated.
situation: A difficult situation where hope nevertheless continues to shine like a beacon.
Idealistic optimism that prevents people from responding to real danger.

Talons.name: Talons
Talons.description: A clawed hand reaches to grab an emerald ring which disintegrates at the claw's approach. The Talons card indicates greed or the rapacious hunger of a predator.

person: A person who preys on other folk to acquire wealth or power.
A person trapped by predatory debt or victimized by a monster that slowly drains the person's life.
creatureTrap: A predator, especially one that preys on people or slowly drains their life (such as a vampire).
A creature hunted for parts of its body that are considered valuable, or for the treasure it hoards.
place: A place where the rich benefit from the labor of the poor.
A tenement or workhouse where oppressed victims of the rich live in squalor.
treasure: A treasure that is a collector's prized possession or the object of a heist.
A treasure that was stolen from its rightful owner.
situation: A situation driven by someone's avarice.
A situation driven by a desperate individual victimized by the greedy.

Tavern.name: Tavern
Tavern.description: A welcoming inn with warm light and gathered patrons, representing hospitality, information, and social gathering.

person: A hospitable host who provides comfort and valuable information
Someone who spreads gossip or uses social situations for manipulation
creatureTrap: Social creatures that gather in groups or communities
Situations where social pressure or group dynamics create danger
place: Gathering places where information, rest, and supplies are available
Places where too much revelry leads to poor decisions or conflict
treasure: Information, contacts, or social connections of great value
Items obtained through questionable deals or drunken wagers
situation: Opportunities to gather information, make allies, or find rest
Social complications, overindulgence, or information that proves unreliable

Temple.name: Temple
Temple.description: A sacred building with soaring architecture, representing divine power, spiritual sanctuary, and higher purpose.

person: A holy person who provides spiritual guidance and divine assistance
A false prophet or corrupted religious figure who misleads the faithful
creatureTrap: Divine beings, angels, or creatures blessed with holy power
Cursed or desecrated areas where divine power has turned malevolent
place: Sacred sanctuaries that offer healing, protection, and divine blessing
Corrupted holy sites where divine power has been twisted or lost
treasure: Holy relics, blessed weapons, or items imbued with divine power
Cursed religious artifacts that punish those who misuse them
situation: Divine intervention, spiritual awakening, or receiving higher guidance
Religious conflict, loss of faith, or punishment for sacrilege

Throne.name: Throne
Throne.description: An ostentatious throne stands on a dais, with a crown on the seat and a ceremonial sword leaning against one armrest. This card represents the authority of worldly rulers.

person: A person who enjoys exercising authority over others and expects to be obeyed.
A person who resents authority imposed on them.
creatureTrap: A creature that leads others of its kind; alternatively, one with magical powers of influence or command.
A creature that unwillingly serves another.
place: A place of authority, such as a palace or a mayor's office.
A place at the edge of a ruler's authority or on the border between rival nations.
treasure: A ruler's regalia, or a magic item (such as a Rod of Rulership) that imparts magical authority.
An art object created as an act of resistance to tyranny, or a magic item that protects against restraint (such as a Ring of Free Action).
situation: A contest over who rightfully holds authority.
A group of people rebelling against a ruler or an authority figure.

Tomb.name: Tomb
Tomb.description: An ancient burial chamber filled with shadows, representing death, endings, and the wisdom of the past.

person: A wise elder who shares knowledge from past experiences
Someone dwelling on past failures or unable to move beyond old wounds
creatureTrap: Undead creatures or spirits that guard ancient secrets
Ancient traps or curses designed to protect burial sites
place: Ancient burial sites containing valuable historical knowledge
Cursed or haunted areas where the dead do not rest peacefully
treasure: Ancient artifacts, historical records, or items of the deceased
Cursed grave goods that bring misfortune to those who disturb them
situation: Learning from the past to avoid repeating old mistakes
Being haunted by past failures or unable to let go of what's gone

Tower.name: Tower
Tower.description: A tall stone structure reaching toward the sky, representing ambition, isolation, and lofty goals.

person: An ambitious visionary who reaches for great heights and achievements
Someone who becomes isolated through pride or builds barriers around themselves
creatureTrap: Flying creatures or beings that control high places
Defenses that require climbing or flying abilities to overcome
place: High vantage points that offer great views and strategic advantage
Isolated locations that are difficult to reach or escape from
treasure: Valuable items placed in high, secure locations
Treasures that are impressive but impractical or isolating
situation: Achieving great heights through ambition and careful planning
Becoming isolated through pride or setting goals too high to reach

Tree.name: Tree
Tree.description: A mighty tree with deep roots and spreading branches, representing growth, stability, and connection to nature.

person: Someone with deep wisdom who provides shelter and guidance to others
A person who becomes rigid or unwilling to adapt to changing circumstances
creatureTrap: Nature spirits, dryads, or creatures that protect forest areas
Natural hazards like falling branches or entangling roots
place: Ancient groves or forests that offer wisdom and natural resources
Overgrown areas where nature has become wild and impassable
treasure: Natural remedies, wooden items of great craftsmanship, or druidic magic
Resources that require patience to cultivate or are tied to natural cycles
situation: Steady growth and development with strong foundations
Stagnation or being too rooted in place to adapt to new circumstances

Undead.name: Undead
Undead.description: A skeletal or ghostly figure from beyond death, representing persistence beyond endings and unfinished business.

person: Someone who perseveres despite overwhelming obstacles or setbacks
A person who cannot let go of the past or move on from old grievances
creatureTrap: Undead creatures that rise again even when defeated
Curses or negative energy that drains life or prevents healing
place: Areas touched by death that hold important secrets or unfinished business
Cursed locations where negative energy prevents rest or peace
treasure: Items that persist beyond their normal limits or provide protection from death
Cursed items that bind the user to unpleasant obligations or drain vitality
situation: Persistence and determination that overcomes seemingly impossible odds
Being unable to move on or being haunted by unresolved issues

Void.name: Void
Void.description: An endless void seems to spiral toward a central hole that devours all. This card spells disaster.

person: A person trapped in despair.
A person who has lost everything and has no place left to go but up.
creatureTrap: A Fiend or an Undead that threatens annihilation of body and soul, or a trap with no easy exit or escape.
A skeleton, zombie, or similar Undead remnant of a living creature; alternatively, a trap that's broken and nonfunctional.
place: A place deep underground, underwater, or in space, where little light and air are available.
A place of utter carnage, where a terrible battle or massacre took place.
treasure: An art object that reflects its creator's despair or sadness, or a Sphere of Annihilation.
A treasure promised but not actually present, such as an empty treasure chest or a looted vault.
situation: A situation that seems to have no good or even survivable outcome.
The aftermath of a destructive event, where the few survivors must figure out how to go on living.

Warrior.name: Warrior
Warrior.description: An armored fighter with weapon in hand, representing strength, courage, and the willingness to fight for what matters.

person: A brave defender who fights for justice and protects the innocent
An aggressive individual who resorts to violence too quickly
creatureTrap: Martial creatures with fighting skills and combat tactics
Combat-oriented challenges that require strength and skill to overcome
place: Training grounds, battlefields, or fortified positions for combat
Areas ravaged by conflict where violence has left lasting damage
treasure: Masterwork weapons, armor, or items that enhance combat abilities
Weapons or armor that come with the burden of past conflicts
situation: Opportunities to show courage and fight for important causes
Conflicts that escalate unnecessarily or violence that solves nothing

Well.name: Well
Well.description: A stone-lined water source, representing depth, hidden resources, and the source of life and wisdom.

person: Someone who provides essential resources or deep wisdom to others
A person who hoards resources or keeps important information hidden
creatureTrap: Creatures that live in or guard water sources
Hidden depths or underwater hazards that pose drowning risks
place: Sources of clean water, healing springs, or places of spiritual renewal
Polluted or cursed water sources that bring sickness or misfortune
treasure: Items that provide sustenance or have been preserved in deep waters
Treasures that are difficult to retrieve or come with water-related curses
situation: Discovering deep resources or wisdom that sustains through difficult times
Running dry of essential resources or finding that trusted sources are contaminated
